ygData.subject: Re: Guard killing  WAS hero bracer quest
ygData.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/22/99 10:53:02 AM Eastern Daylight Time, lanadina@hotmail.com writes:
ygData.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/22/99 10:53:02 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
lanadina@... writes:

<< eptin,

Training guards and what not on you and blocking the zones is ILLEGAL. I am
a dark elf myself, and had a few friends of the 'good'aligned races come
into Neriak's foreign quarters killing the guards. A few dark elves and
trolls decided to start training NPCs on them, and the trolls BLOCKED the
zone. No one could leave unless they gated or evaced.

A GM was called on the scene, and the players harrassing were given an
official warning. My barbarian friend had died because of this zone
blocking, causing him to lose his level.

Roleplaying is one thing...causing people to die, and harrassing them is a
totally different story.

Lanadina >>


This is rediculous. I think that members of a particular race working to
protect thier home city guards is roleplaying in its highest form. While
training guards that will then kill you may bend what would happen in
reality, I think it is far less relaistic to expect the denizens of a
particular city to stand idly by as thier beloved guards are being killed,
especially by members of an opposing race. I think it adds a whole new lvl
of challenge to groups of high lvls who wish to conquer a city. If those
high lvls cannot handle that challenge they should stick to the plenty of
other places where they can get exp and items and have fun.

The Neriak storming event that Keptin talked about happened as he said on
Solusek Ro. Solusek Ro is probably the worst roleplaying server that exists
and is almost exclusively a power gaming -hey dude- you suck - cool man! -
server. I know, my 25 Wizard lives there. It does not surprise me that
Keptin thus complains about what happened.

I tell you what friends, try to attack my guards in Erudin I will stand with
them to the end!!

Wizaro Wrathcaster
